name: Sheraton Lisboa Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend another few nights here after few years and we were once again very glad about this hotel. It is still well maintained with a design and quality which again impressed us. We paid for a club level room which left us little dissapointed as the offer in the lounge was very very limited (comparing to Interconti or hyatt club levels which we can compare to), also luxury toilettries mentioned in the reservation confirmation (Hermes) were not provided and instead some basic and not appealing bliss products in the bathroom placed. I am mentioning it as these were the reasons to pay the extra for club here. Otherwise nothing to complain about. Maybe just question why they removed one of only two chandeliers in the main restaurant which results in very dark and obscure atmosphere in this place which is also without windows.
reviews.title: one of the best from sheraton chain
A very good hotel in Lisbon, Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in late June 2009 (my wife and I). A very good hotel. Beautiful rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Located abit out of the centre, but we walked it no problem + taxis are VERY inexpensive in Lisbon. Recommend staying here if you can get a good rate.
I travelled to Lisbon with my daughter and had a wonderful time in Lisbon because of the excellent service provided by the concierge and the reception staff at this hotel Sheraton Lisboa.
reviews.title: Excellent Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at this property as we are Gold Starwood members, though our status was not acknowledged when checking in. I had chosen a club room due to previously positive experiences with club lounges.
reviews.title: Stay In The Historical District

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in process was smooth, but we were very surprised when reaching our room on the 20th floor (lowest floor of the club floors). The hallway and hotel room look like a mixture of a spaceship and an upscale Japanese love hotel (the one you check into to partake in adult activities for 3 hours). Otherwise the hotel was quite clean, though the bed is a little short for someone of my height (about 194 cm tall).
reviews.title: Top notch hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was really pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The standard of the rooms is really very high. The staff so friendly an d helpful too.
reviews.title: Great hotel, much better than expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is smaller than had hoped with no view, but the spa facilities are pretty good.
reviews.title: Don't stay here for the Spa
Simply put, this is the place to stay in Lisbon.
reviews.text: The hotel is a high quality international business hotel.
The rooms were very well appointed especially the bathroom - and impeccably clean.
reviews.title: OK- but!

reviews.text: The staff were polite but not particularly friendly.
reviews.title: Rubbish hotel, rubbish city - Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i loved the rooms at this hotel. impeccably finished, from the LED lighting, to the remote controlled blinds, to the bang and olufesen lcd tv. This hotel definitely oozed contemporary suave. We especially liked the bathroom, and we were able to enjoy the bathtub as well. The bed was a little hard for our liking, and Internet wasn't free... but at least they had 6 computers in the lobby that hotel guests could use for free. we used cash and points (Starwood preferred guest) to stay here, and it was more than worth it.
reviews.title: beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also ended up using their 'spa' amenities.... you see, in order to use the beautiful pool, huge jacuzzi, steam room, sauna, gym, etc... you have to pay 12 euro per person. We ended up doing so for you get in and out privileges for the day... so we said, sure.. why not. It's great if you do it on a sunny day, and on a day that you want to lounge around the pool.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, good service, disappointing breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, and close to the metro too!
reviews.title: The Best Views of the City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in mid September 2009 on the 20th floor in a Club room. The room was well equipped and comfortable, although the coffee / tea maker was difficult to get to work properly (so tepid drinks). The bed was very comfortable. Front of house, chamber maid and bar people were excellent, courteous, knowledgeable and had good English. The breakfast was lukewarm and OK is about as good as you say. Ease of transport to the City Centre makes this a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Not what it promises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My review is a bit biased as we got upgraded to a club room on the 25th floor upon check-in (SPG platinum rocks). Wow! I mean WOW! The room was elegantly designed with views from the windows overlooking Lisboa! The modern furnishings, bed etcc were comfortable and spotless and the shower - well that was just plain SEXY...! The interiors remind us more of the W (very stylish). One still has to pay extra for access to the pool and spa (jaccuzzi and sauna) facilities. The rooftop bar (Panorama) had unbelievable city views. The lobby has several terminals for free internet access. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful, esp the concierge (dinner recs were excellent).
reviews.title: Wow! Very impressive hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a gorgeous, upscale hotel with full amenities. It seems to cater to business travelers and is in a residential/corporate office neighborhood--not the most convenient for sightseeing, but there is a Metro station across the street. We had a club-level room that was perfect in every way. The room was huge, bed was firm and comfortable, and the lighting was superb. Everything was impeccably modern, including the electronically controlled blackout curtain for the window. A vast breakfast buffet was included in the room rate. All hotel staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Upscale American-style Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This ultra-modern hotel in Lisbon is very interesting. From the leather-clad hallways and doors leading to your room you know you are in for a treat. The rooms are very well appointed with dark wood and leather trim everywhere. Multiple light settings can set the mood of the room from very business like to very romantic. One of the best features of the rooms are the bathrooms. Very modern style bathroom with views into the room! The location of the hotel is close to the central park area and close to public transportation. The restaurant/bar on the top floor gives spectacular views of Lisbon.
reviews.title: Bathrooms are WOW!

reviews.text: Stayed here many times in the last 5/6 years. The rooms are reasonable, the last renovation improved the quality. However there the service and quality is lacking for a Sheraton and for Hotel that level. Shower is not really warm and very low water pressure. Worse is the realibility of the service. In-room coffee machine but don't expect the coffee capsulas to be there or the replaced. don't be surpriced if the bathroom amenities have been used and to pay to the use of a swimming pool. Even so I'm a Starwood Platinum guest, there is substantial fee for the pool because only the fitness room is free whereas the confirmation states the "health club". To make it short: next time I stay in a different hotel. not recommended.
reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite my initial desire to stay in a local or regional chain (for the cultural insight) we decided to "play it safe" and stay at the Sheraton. Overall, the hotel was clean, the rooms spacious, and the concierge more than willing to help with any request.
reviews.title: Great location, nice gym, modern design in rooms

reviews.text: I visited Lisbon for the time and spent 5 nights at The Sheraton Grand. The hotel is situated in the business district. Notwithstanding ,it is still very close to the famous Avenida de Liberdade. This is a long avenue lined with shops and some hotels. Here one finds Armani, Trussardi and other big fashion names. The dept. stores and malls are outside the city centre in Lisbon. These can be reached by taxi. A taxi ride of say 15 - 20 minutes is normally in the regon of 6 euro, which makes it the obvious choice to travel around the city. The hotel has two striking features: the corridors are quite dark and their walls are panelled with white galss, at first they seem rather dull but once you get used to them they are quite unique. Another feature is the restaurant at the very top floor. In the evening this is the palce from where to see all of lisbon as far as the ocean. Simply great, not just for the view but also for the excellent cuisine. Pricing is obviously a bit higher. If one is used to most european cities, Lisbon proves to be quite cheap. Very good restuarants serving typical Portughese food as well as other cuisines normally cost around 80euro for two persons having a full meal incl. starter,main course wine desert and coffee. Lisbon tends to have a hot climate. So the best way to see it is early morning, and after 4-5 pm. The evenings are pleasant. I would aslo fit in a day trip to Sintra, a mediveal city just a few km outside Lisbon, even this is accessibile by taxi. I would stay away from hiring a car. Driving tends to be rather rough, and chaotic. Beware of the taxi meters, some drivers tend to be cheeky and charge more than they should. A final good word must go to the concierges of the hotel. These were all very helpful when we needed their help. The doormen too were also always very prompt to call a taxi from just round the corner and expalin to the driver where we wished to go. English is normally understood in Lisbon. but having some knowledge of Italian helps. I would go back to both hotel and city maybe in the cooler months.
reviews.title: A modern classic hotel with excellent service

description: Completely refurbished combining modern elegance and simple relaxing design, the hotel is located in one of the city's most prestigious business districts. Only 15 minutes from Lisbon's International Airport, the Sheraton is easily accessible by train, bus, subway or car, with fabulous shopping, theatres, art museums, and nightlife just a short walk away.
